author: CHRISTOPHER BRENNAN
title: Pakistani court bans Valentine's Day, says it is against Islam
text:
Pakistani court bans Valentine's Day, says it violates Islamic teachings Pakistani court bans Valentine's Day, says it is against Islam An Islamabad, Pakistan, court has ordered a ban on Valentine's Day promotions. Above, an Islamabad couple buy flowers to celebrate Valentine's Day on Monday. (B.K. Bangash/AP) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated:  25 PM 
Roses are red. Violets are blue. A judge in Pakistan has ruled on Valentine's Day, and he wants to bid it adieu. 
A court in the country’s capital Islamabad has put a ban on celebrating the Christian holiday Monday, telling a media regulator that there should be a city-wide blackout on all V-Day promotions. 
Pakistan trails the U.S. and Europe in observing the holiday celebrating the life of the third-century Roman Saint Valentine, which built off the pagan fertility holiday of Lupercalia. 
But some in the country have begun using it to advertise its products, leading conservatives to label Valentine's Day as a Western interloper that is not compatible with traditional Pakistani values. 
While some lovelorn Americans angry at their single status may think that February 14 celebrations are a scam thought up by florists and greeting card companies, court petitioner Abdul Waheed had said that it violated Islamic teachings. A Pakistani vendor carries heart-shaped bouquets for sale ahead of Valentine's Day. (AAMIR QURESHI/AFP/Getty Images) 
He said that instead of love, it promoted “immorality, nudity and indecency,” according to newspaper Dawn . 
The Islamabad court agreed, prohibiting any official or public events celebrating Valentine’s Day in addition to its media ban. 
Waheed’s victory comes after growing resistance from those who think that the holiday’s labors of love should get lost. 
Last year Pakistani President Mamnoon Hussain told his countrymen to stick to their studies and avoid indulging in a date that had “no connection” to their culture. Join the Conversation:
